Posts.Title: 3-months post-surgery and... my hair is breaking. Anyone else? sunshinegal NJMarilyn

Posts.Content: sunshinegal wrote: I am experiencing a freaky hair loss situation, and I should say up front that I have not had chemo.  A few days ago, I noticed a few short strands of hair -- bangs, sort of -- poking up from under the longer hair around it (that I usually sweep off to the side of my face). I thought "heh, weird, I guess it's some new hair that's at that awkward growing out length." The bang-type strands were about 1.5" long whereas the rest of the hair framing my face is 4-6" long.  The next day, it seemed like there was more of it. I joked with my husband - what, did you take scissors to my head overnight? He laughed - of course not. Two days later, and it is extremely noticeable: I have bona fide 1.5" bangs, and there have been no scissors anywhere near my head in the last 2 months! I can't for the life of me figure out what's happening. I can't trace it to any big diet or product changes, though my hair seems very dull and lifeless all of a sudden. I honestly have no idea what's going on, but in a google search tonight I came across the theory that surgery and anasthesia can affect hair's life cycle, about three months later.   Well here I am three months post mastectomy, so could that be it?? What is totally freaking me out is that my hair isn't falling out, it's clearly breaking off somehow, but I don't see evidence on my pillow or in my hairbrush. Any thoughts???
